author: Mother Teresa

quote: For me, trees have always been the most penetrating preachers. I revere them when they live in tribes and families, in forests and groves. And even more I revere them when they stand alone. They are like lonely persons. Not like hermits who have stolen away out of some weakness, but like great, solitary men, like Beethoven and Nietzsche. In their highest boughs the world rustles, their roots rest in infinity; but they do not lose themselves there, they struggle with all the force of their lives for one thing only: to fulfil themselves according to their own laws, to build up their own form, to represent themselves. Nothing is holier, nothing is more exemplary than a beautiful, strong tree. When a tree is cut down and reveals its naked death-wound to the sun, one can read its whole history in the luminous, inscribed disk of its trunk: in the rings of its years, its scars, all the struggle, all the suffering, all the sickness, all the happiness and prosperity stand truly written, the narrow years and the luxurious years, the attacks withstood, the storms endured. And every young farmboy knows that the hardest and noblest wood has the narrowest rings, that high on the mountains and in continuing danger the most indestructible, the strongest, the ideal trees grow.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
author: Anita Desai

quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
author: Irina Dunn

quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them
author: Thomas Merton

quote: No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.
author: Jay Asher

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths;
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quote: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.
author: John Green

quote: I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..
author: مصطفى محمود

quote: Winter is coming.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: !لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم
author: غسان كنفاني

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Politeness is deception in pretty packaging.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: As if you were on fire from within.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
author: David Levithan

quote: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: I am different, not less.
author: Temple Grandin

quote: أتمنى أن أبكي و أرتجف , التصق بواحد من الكبار , لكن الحقيقة القاسية هي أنك الكبار! .. أنت من يجب أن يمنح القوة و الأمن للآخرين!
author: أحمد خالد توفيق

quote: The creative adult is the child who has survived.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I am a cage, in search of a bird.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.
author: Steve Wozniak

quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
author: Dan Brown

quote: For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
author: Mark Twain

quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.
author: Norton Juster

quote: From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: You do not have to be good.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.
author: Lady Gaga

quote: There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.
author: John Cheever

quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: When I am with you, we stay up all night.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
author: George Carlin

quote: Ah, my daughter,ʺ he said. ʺEighteen, and already youʹve been accused of murder, aided felons, and acquired a death count higher than most guardians will ever see.ʺ He paused. ʺI couldnʹt be prouder.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.
author: Kate DiCamillo

quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
author: John Lennon

quote: Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.
author: Marguerite Duras

quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: A good book is an event in my life.
author: Stendhal

quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Love is the absence of judgment.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!
author: Edward J. Stieglitz

quote: When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
author: Bette Midler

quote: You will lose someone you can’t live without,and your heart will be badly broken, and the bad news is that you never completely get over the loss of your beloved. But this is also the good news. They live forever in your broken heart that doesn’t seal back up. And you come through. It’s like having a broken leg that never heals perfectly—that still hurts when the weather gets cold, but you learn to dance with the limp.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.
author: S.E. Hinton

quote: Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.
author: Jane Austen

quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Try a little harder to be a little better.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.
author: John Green

quote: If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: So many things become beautiful when you really look.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
author: José N. Harris

quote: Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...
author: Keri Hulme

quote: You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry’s legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it’s true you’ve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The helpful thought for which you look
author: Edward Gorey

quote: you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

quote: Knock, And He'll open the door
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: There is no place like home.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...
author: Markus Zusak

quote: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: You only get one life. It's actually your duty to live it as fully as possible.
author: Jojo Moyes

quote: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.
author: Mark Twain

quote: You can't stop the future
author: Jay Asher

quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
author: François Mauriac

quote: I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: May the odds be ever in your favor!
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: The spell. Victor said you had to want me... to care about me... for it to work." When he didn't say anything, I tried to grip his shirt, but my fingers were too weak. "Did you? Did you want me?"
author: Richelle Mead

quote: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.
author: E.Y. Harburg

quote: There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them.
author: John Boyne

quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.
author: John Grisham

quote: In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Dreams like a podcast,
author: Rick Riordan

quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
author: Mae West

quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
author: Michael Ondaatje

quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars,
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
author: Margaret Walker

quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
author: Stephanie Perkins

quote: I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over.
author: Eugene Field

quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.
author: William Saroyan

quote: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

quote: I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: I lived in books more than I lived anywhere else.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
author: William Blake

quote: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: You're an idiot."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: In a time of destruction, create something.
author: Maxine Hong Kingston

quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms...
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
author: P.C. Cast

quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Your beliefs become your thoughts,
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: My soul will find yours.
author: Jude Deveraux

quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
author: A.A. Milne

quote: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: Reading brings us unknown friends
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Are you implying that shreds of my reputation remain intact?" Will demanded with mock horror. "Clearly I have been doing something wrong. Or not something wrong, as the case may be."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
author: Dan Brown

quote: I'm going to wake Peeta," I say.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can’t know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi’s note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.
author: John Green

quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.
author: Henry Miller

quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A house without books is like a room without windows.
author: Horace Mann

quote: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: It was a mistake," you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.
author: David Levithan

quote: Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.
author: William Golding

quote: A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?
author: Stephanie Perkins

quote: We are all alone, born alone, die alone, and—in spite of True Romance magazines—we shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. I do not say lonely—at least, not all the time—but essentially, and finally, alone. This is what makes your self-respect so important, and I don't see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: People come, people go – they’ll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides

quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question:
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.
author: David Mitchell

quote: I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.
author: John Green

quote: Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.
author: Brian Jacques

quote: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: People change and forget to tell each other.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.
author: Lauren Kate

quote: Let our scars fall in love.
author: Galway Kinnell

quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: But he who dares not grasp the thorn
author: Anne Brontë

quote: Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.
author: John Green

quote: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
author: Mark Twain

quote: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.
author: Fannie Flagg

quote: I must have loved you a lot.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.
author: Eric Roth

quote: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.
author: Karen Marie Moning

quote: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: I drink to make other people more interesting.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.
author: Arthur O'Shaughnessy

quote: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way.
author: Stanisław Lem

quote: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.
author: Nick Hornby

quote: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.
author: Astrid Lindgren

quote: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.
author: Lev Grossman

quote: و كن من أنتَ حيث تكون
author: Mahmoud Darwish

quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
author: Max Lucado

quote: The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.
author: W.C. Fields

quote: A truth that's told with bad intent
author: William Blake

quote: It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.
author: W.G. Sebald

quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Jace shook his blond head in exasperation.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare? I say.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: It is never too late to be wise.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة
author: أحمد خالد توفيق

quote: I cannot go to school today"
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quote: She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Did you see that dress? "I saw the dress. "Did you like it? He didn't answer. I took that as a yes. "Am I going to endanger my reputation if I wear it to the dance? When he spoke, I could barely hear him. "You'll endanger the school. I smiled and fell asleep.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Still round the corner there may wait
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Who, being loved, is poor?
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
author: George Orwell

quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.
author: Joshua Slocum

quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It must require bravery to be honest all the time.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: You like someone who can't like you back because unrequited love can be survived in a way that once-requited love cannot.
author: John Green

quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: All great and precious things are lonely.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Have you really read all those books in your room?
author: John Green

quote: I want to see you.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.
author: Neil LaBute

quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.
author: Alan Moore

quote: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر
author: مصطفى محمود

quote: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.
author: John Updike

quote: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.
author: Brian Andreas

quote: A party without cake is just a meeting
author: Julia Child

quote: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut
author: Albert Einstein

quote: In order to rise
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: My rapier wit hides my inner pain.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.
author: Julian Barnes

quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.
author: Arrigo Boito

quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: A lot of you cared, just not enough.
author: Jay Asher

quote: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: I get a warm feeling among my books.
author: Anthony Powell

quote: I know we're fucked up, alright? I'm impulsive, and hot tempered, and you get under my skin like no one else. You act like you hate me one minute, and then need me the next. I never get anything right, and I don't deserve you...but I fucking love you, Abby. I love you more than I loved anyone or anything ever. When you're around, I don't need booze, or money, or the fighting, or the one-night stands...
author: Jamie McGuire

quote: Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.
author: Stieg Larsson

quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
author: Nikolai Gogol

quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.
author: Glen Cook

quote: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively
author: Bob Marley

quote: Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.
author: Jo Walton

quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: What do you want?"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Headline?" he asked.
author: John Green

quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love.
author: Laini Taylor

quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?
author: Douglas Adams

quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: In the end
author: Jack Kornfield

quote: I'd rather die my way than live yours.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve.
author: Carol Shields

quote: Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through."
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A library is infinity under a roof.
author: Gail Carson Levine

quote: Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

quote: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.
author: T.H. White

quote: Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: George Eliot

quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.
author: P.C. Cast

quote: You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written — behind your silence and your suffering.
author: Anne Rice

quote: Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.
author: Jasper Fforde

quote: These violent delights have violent ends
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
author: Michelle Hodkin

quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Sonnet XVII
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: you have to love something before you can hate it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you’ll take me in your arms again.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir

quote: Black holes are where God divided by zero.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: One word
author: Sophocles

quote: When I was your age, television was called books.
author: William Goldman

quote: A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: To the people who look at the stars and wish, Rhys."
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: Where words leave off, music begins.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
author: Socrates

quote: If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.
author: George S. Patton Jr.

quote: Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: What is family? They were the people who claimed you. In good, in bad, in parts or in whole, they were the ones who showed up, who stayed in there, regardless. It wasn't just about blood relations or shared chromosomes, but something wider, bigger. We had many families over time. Our family of origin, the family we created, and the groups you moved through while all of this was happening: friends, lovers, sometimes even strangers. None of them perfect, and we couldn't expect them to be. You can't make any one person your world. The trick was to take what each could give you and build your world from it.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Patience, grasshopper," said Maia. "Good things come to those who wait."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: أي علم هذا الذي لم يستطع حتى الآن أن يضع أصوات من نحب في أقراص ، أو زجاجة دواء نتناولها سرًّا ، عندما نصاب بوعكة عاطفية بدون أن يدري صاحبها كم نحن نحتاجه
author: أحلام مستغانمي

quote: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: By the pricking of my thumbs,
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!
author: Emily Brontë

quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.
author: Hal Borland

quote: The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.
author: Peter Shaffer

quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
author: Yann Martel

quote: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: My library is an archive of longings.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: My bounty is as boundless as the sea,
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The earth has its music for those who will listen
author: Reginald Vincent Holmes

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.
author: Danielle Steel

quote: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: What day is it?"
author: A.A. Milne

quote: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: I will remember the kisses
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
author: Steve Martin

quote: You can make anything by writing.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I don't go out with strangers," I said.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.
author: Cornelia Funke

quote: No. I can survive well enough on my own— if given the proper reading material.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quote: I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: As it has been said:
author: Anne Sexton

quote: I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.
author: Lemony Snicket
