quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I guess that’s just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: You might want to lie down," Magnus advised. "I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
author: Robert Frost

quote: Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.
author: Terry McMillan

quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: The voice of the sea speaks to the soul.
author: Kate Chopin

quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: One person's craziness is another person's reality.
author: Tim Burton

quote: She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.
author: Henry James

quote: Magnus, standing by the door, snapped his fingers impatiently. "Move it along, teenagers. The only person who gets to canoodle in my bedroom is my magnificent self."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: An Unbreakable Vow?" said Ron, looking stunned. "Nah, he can’t have.... Are you sure?"
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
author: Mae West

quote: You're the first Shadowhunter I've ever met."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.
author: R.A. Salvatore

quote: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.
author: Stieg Larsson

quote: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
author: Pittacus Lore

quote: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.
author: J.R. Ward

quote: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Gus: "It tastes like..."
author: John Green

quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...
author: John Lennon

quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead;
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.
author: Katharine Graham

quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: My course is set for an uncharted sea.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.
author: Stephen King

quote: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.
author: Anne Rice

quote: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
author: Emilie Autumn

quote: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.
author: Donald E. Westlake

quote: To put everything in balance is good, to put everything in harmony is better.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
author: Conan O'Brien

quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Little by little, one travels far
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.
author: Peter S. Beagle

quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.
author: Michael Crichton

quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.
author: E.L. James

quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You’re dangerous, he says.
author: Simone Elkeles

quote: I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
author: Beatrix Potter

quote: Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: I think; therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

quote: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.
author: Geraldine Brooks

quote: I wonder if the snow
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

quote: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
author: John Muir

quote: If I am really a part of your dream, you'll come back one day.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Only you can control your future.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: We sit silently and watch the world around us. This has taken a lifetime to learn. It seems only the old are able to sit next to one another and not say anything and still feel content. The young, brash and impatient, must always break the silence. It is a waste, for silence is pure. Silence is holy. It draws people together because only those who are comfortable with each other can sit without speaking. This is the great paradox.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.
author: Melissa Marr

quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Very few of us are what we seem.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Tears are words that need to be written.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Shut your eyes and see.
author: James Joyce

quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
author: James     Baldwin

quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea.
author: Karen Blixen

quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that while a partner can add sweet dimensions to our lives, we, each of us, are responsible for our own fulfillment. Nobody else can provide it for us, and to believe otherwise is to delude ourselves dangerously and to program for eventual failure every relationship we enter.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
author: John Green

quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
author: Anne Frank

quote: In the world I am
author: Bei Dao

quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
author: Pat  Monahan

quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.
author: Seán O'Casey

quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: so I wait for you like a lonely house
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Let everything happen to you
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
author: Mark Twain

quote: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.
author: John Green

quote: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.
author: James  Burke

quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
author: Plato

quote: Be glad. Be good. Be brave.
author: Eleanor H. Porter

quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
author: George Carlin

quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.
author: Harvey Fierstein

quote: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: That which you believe becomes your world.
author: Richard Matheson

quote: I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: I’m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.
author: John Green

quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: [D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: I got schooled this year
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.
author: Annie Proulx

quote: Alec looked at her and shook his head. "How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Break my heart. Break it a thousand times if you like. It was only ever yours to break anyway.
author: Kiera Cass

quote: silence is the language of god,
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: those who escape hell
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: In my next life I want to live my life backwards. You start out dead and get that out of the way. Then you wake up in an old people's home feeling better every day. You get kicked out for being too healthy, go collect your pension, and then when you start work, you get a gold watch and a party on your first day. You work for 40 years until you're young enough to enjoy your retirement. You party, drink alcohol, and are generally promiscuous, then you are ready for high school. You then go to primary school, you become a kid, you play. You have no responsibilities, you become a baby until you are born. And then you spend your last 9 months floating in luxurious spa-like conditions with central heating and room service on tap, larger quarters every day and then Voila! You finish off as an orgasm!
author: Woody Allen

quote: What's up?" I asked.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
author: Molière

quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
author: Jane Yolen

quote: I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.
author: Emily Brontë

quote: Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.
author: Marissa Meyer

quote: Have you tried talking to her?"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
author: Caroline Gordon

quote: Some walks you have to take alone.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: I like good strong words that mean something…
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: It's going to be all right, sir," Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. "We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ..."
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.
author: George Carlin

quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: It's much easier to not know things sometimes. Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody. I wanted to laugh. Or maybe get mad. Or maybe shrug at how strange everybody was, especially me. I think the idea is that every person has to live for his or her own life and than make the choice to share it with other people. You can't just sit their and put everybody's lives ahead of yours and think that counts as love. You just can't. You have to do things. I'm going to do what I want to do. I'm going to be who I really am. And I'm going to figure out what that is. And we could all sit around and wonder and feel bad about each other and blame a lot of people for what they did or didn't do or what they didn't know. I don't know. I guess there could always be someone to blame. It's just different. Maybe it's good to put things in perspective, but sometimes, I think that the only perspective is to really be there. Because it's okay to feel things. I was really there. And that was enough to make me feel infinite. I feel infinite.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
author: Gayle Forman

quote: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.
author: Randy Pausch

quote: I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.
author: Jennifer Egan

quote: Trains are great dirty smoky things," said Will. "You won't like it."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.
author: Steven Spielberg

quote: I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: He awoke each morning with the desire to do right, to be a good and meaningful person, to be, as simple as it sounded and as impossible as it actually was, happy. And during the course of each day his heart would descend from his chest into his stomach. By early afternoon he was overcome by the feeling that nothing was right, or nothing was right for him, and by the desire to be alone. By evening he was fulfilled: alone in the magnitude of his grief, alone in his aimless guilt, alone even in his loneliness.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?"
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.
author: Nora Roberts

quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.
author: Laini Taylor

quote: Is there no way out of the mind?
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.
author: Candace Bushnell

quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.
author: Julio Cortázar

quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.
author: Amy Tan

quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.
author: Rainbow Rowell

quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: The unfed mind devours itself.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.
author: John W. Campbell Jr.

quote: To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.
author: Art Spiegelman

quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.
author: Lauren Conrad

quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.
author: Ransom Riggs

quote: To err is human, to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.
author: Jane Austen

quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.
author: Sheng Wang

quote: When God Created Mothers"
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Do not fall in love with people like me.
author: Caitlyn Siehl

quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
author: Rose Wilder Lane

quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The past is never where you think you left it.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

quote: This is the way the world ends
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.
author: John Green

quote: But I love your feet
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: People have forgotten this truth," the fox said. "But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible forever for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
author: W.E.B. Du Bois

quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
author: Philip José Farmer

quote: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.
author: Selma Lagerlöf

quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: Dignity
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?
author: Nicole Krauss

quote: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
author: Mark Twain

quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.
author: Nadezhda Mandelstam

quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
author: Julie Kagawa

quote: If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.
author: Stephen King

quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
author: Rachel Caine

quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think
author: Socrates

quote: You are okay?" he asked. "Not eaten by monsters?"
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The only truth is music.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.
author: Walter Tevis

quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.
author: Albert Dietrich

quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.
author: Warsan Shire

quote: Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things. The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: One must dare to be happy.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney Company

quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
author: Fannie Flagg

quote: So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ...
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained.
author: Jonathan Ames

quote: No sight so sad as that of a naughty child," he began, "especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?"
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: to love life, to love it even
author: Ellen Bass

quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
author: David Nicholls

quote: 1. Be Impeccable With Your Word
author: Miguel Ruiz

quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Can you surf really well, then?"
author: Rick Riordan

quote: The past is always tense, the future perfect.
author: Zadie Smith

quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?
author: Neil Jordan

quote: Moths," repeats Will. "You're afraid of moths?"
author: Veronica Roth

quote: I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You're a guardian angel now." I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.
author: Jarod Kintz

quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.
author: Alyson Noel

quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.
author: Nicole Krauss

quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?
author: Mark Twain

quote: Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
author: Mae West

quote: Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way.
author: Janet Fitch

quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
author: Anne Frank

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
author: John Green

quote: ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟
author: عباس محمود العقاد

quote: When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.
author: John Green

quote: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!
author: C.J. Cherryh

quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
author: John Green

quote: Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know.
author: Sarah Vowell

quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Nothing behind me, everything ahead of me, as is ever so on the road.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

quote: There are three questions every woman should be able to answer yes to before they commit to a man. If you answer no to any of the three questions, run like hell."
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: Um...is that thing
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: ...you can hate a place with all your heart and soul and still be homesick for it.
author: Joseph Mitchell

quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your
author: Harlan Ellison

quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: There are much worse games to play.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: At the end of the day, we can endure much more than we think we can.
author: Frida Kahlo

quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
author: Harper Lee

quote: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.
author: Lois Lowry

quote: Demon pox, oh demon pox
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.
author: Rainbow Rowell

quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
author: H.L. Mencken

quote: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.
author: John Green

quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I’ve been fighting to be who I am all my life. What’s the point of being who I am, if I can’t have the person who was worth all the fighting for?
author: Stephanie  Lennox

quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
author: John Green

quote: Freedom lies in being bold.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The only lies for which we are truly punished are those we tell ourselves.
author: V.S. Naipaul

quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.
author: David Levithan

quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your silence will not protect you.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
author: Mae West

quote: make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: I don’t trust anybody. Not anybody. And the more that I care about someone, the more sure I am they’re going to get tired of me and take off.
author: Rainbow Rowell

quote: Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.
author: Marvin Bell

quote: Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
author: China Miéville

quote: Our finger prints don't fade from the lives we touch.
author: Judy Blume

quote: People do not change, they are merely revealed.
author: Anne Enright

quote: I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Clary felt suddenly annoyed. "When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Remember this: Nothing is written in the stars. Not these stars, nor any others. No one controls your destiny.
author: Gregory Maguire

quote: I desire the things that will destroy me in the end.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Do you think that I count the days? There is only one day left, always starting over: it is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
author: Dean Koontz

quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
author: Henry Thomas Buckle

quote: Beauty is terror. Whatever we call beautiful, we quiver before it.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.
author: Bob Newhart

quote: Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: The mind I love must have wild places.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones."
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: George Washington Burnap

quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
author: C.G. Jung

quote: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard.
author: John Grisham

quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Jace?"
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.
author: Audrey Niffenegger

quote: Humor is reason gone mad.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: For me, literacy means freedom. For the individual and for society.
author: LeVar Burton

quote: I pray because I can't help myself. I pray because I'm helpless. I pray because the need flows out of me all the time- waking and sleeping. It doesn't change God- it changes me.
author: William Nicholson

quote: I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
author: Dan Brown

quote: Curiouser and curiouser!
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: People, generally, suck.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: But-" Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: مش مهم انك تغير الكون... المهم انك تخلي الكون ما يغيركش
author: عمر طاهر

quote: You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: You’ll get over it… It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.
author: Patricia Cornwell

quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
author: Betty Smith

quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Sebastian just smiled. I could hear your heart beating, he said softly. When you were watching me with Valentine. Did it bother you?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
author: Chaim Potok

quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
author: James Lecesne

quote: You always have a choice. It's just that some people make the wrong one.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
author: John Updike

quote: الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا
author: أحلام مستغانمي

quote: I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: You will hear thunder and remember me,
author: Anna Akhmatova

quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter
author: John Keats

quote: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.
author: Robert J. Sawyer

quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: The major problem—
author: Douglas Adams

quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Watch out for intellect,
author: Anne Sexton

quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.
author: George Orwell

quote: What else? She is so beautiful. You don’t get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don’t get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.
author: John Green

quote: When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: The problem with doing nothing is not knowing when you are finished.
author: Nelson DeMille

quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: You only live twice:
author: Ian Fleming

quote: Even
Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will.
author: Mary Stewart

quote: A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: Silence is so freaking loud
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: While I sleep, I dream of you, and when I wake, I long to hold you in my arms. If anything, our time apart has only made me more certain that I want to spend my nights by your side, and my days with your heart.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
author: Erica Jong

quote: There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.
author: Richelle Mead

quote: It's the mortal cup Jace, not the mortal toilet bowl.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The moon is a loyal companion.
author: Tahereh Mafi

quote: In the summer
author: Nizar Qabbani

quote: Atticus, he was real nice."
author: Harper Lee

quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.
author: John Green

quote: Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.
author: David Mitchell

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
